name: §a§nShadow Arts III
description: You can manipulate the shadows to assist you in assassinations.

text: §a§nConcealed Presence
You slowly conceal your presence with the help of your shadow.
§nExplanation§r:
While remaining still, you slowly conceal your presence. You will gain the following when fully concealed:
§a-§r Lose aggro from mobs
§a-§r Prevent receiving aggro from mobs
§a-§r Armor, items, and such become invisibile
§e-§r Can move around as long as you are sneaking
§e-§r Emit a Shadow Trail
§c-§r Particle effects and the §cGlowing§r effect outline will still be visible
Whenever you move without sneaking, receive §cGlowing§r effect, getting hit, or hitting, will result you to reveal your presence.
§a§nShadow Betrayal I
You can make your target's shadow betray themselves.
§nExplanation§r:
Your melee attacks have a §a50%§r to inflict §cShadow Betrayal§r §ffor §c30§r §fseconds. Successful backstabs or using assassinate will always guarantee §cShadow Betrayal§r §ffor §c30§r §fseconds.
§cShadow Betrayal§r is a debuff that will do the following:
§c-§r Get rid of the regeneration effect upon application
§c-§r Emit particle effects and create deceiving sounds
§c-§r Make it difficult for the target to see their health
§c-§r Reduce healing effectiveness by §c50%
§c-§r Be detected by Dark Elves and their Evolutions in a §a60§r block radius
§a§nDarkness Embraced
Dark spreads Shadows and Shadows create Darkness.
§nExplanation§r:
While on a block with a light level less than §a9§r and away from the Sun, your melee attacks will deal §a1.25x§r damage.
The cooldown rate for §d§nShadow Cloak§r
will also be §a3x§r faster.
§e§nLeave no Trace
Upon death, your shadow will try to consume everything, making it seem like you were never there.
§nExplanation§r:
Your shadow will also lash out, attempting to consume all entities. Giving them §cWither V§r §fand §cSlowness II§r§f. Entities such as items will be completely consumed.
§4CURRENTLY BUGGED
Due to a bug right now, the "Shadows" you spawn are visible when they have the Glowing Effect. They normally should not be visible.
